questions.text: In which year did the Philippines gain independence from the United States?
questions.explanation:
1946.

	These islands, for centuries part the Spanish Empire, were ceded to the US following the Spanish-American War and were a US territory from 1900-46.

questions.text: Why does our moon have no atmosphere?
options: It is too close to the Earth
questions.explanation:
It has too little gravity.

	You can also say it has too little mass.

a female college graduate.

	A male college graduate is called an alumnus. The plural - alumni - is used for both male graduates and male and female graduates. The plural of alumna is alumnae.

questions.text: On which planet would you weigh the most?
questions.explanation:
Jupiter.

	Jupiter is also the largest planet.

questions.text: Most fossils are found in what type of rock?
Which city is not in Germany?
questions.explanation:
Prague.

	Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic (and of the former Kingdom of Bohemia).

questions.text: What is the most common English name of King Arthur's sword?

questions.explanation:
light green.

	Remember when you open it from the shell it has a green color.

questions.text: At the time of the French Revolution, what was the Bastille?
questions.explanation:
a prison.

	The storming of the Bastille on 14 July 1789 is widely taken as the first revolutionary action in the French Revolution.

questions.text: In what continent is Swahili widely spoken?
questions.explanation:
Africa.

	Africa ... I would like to go there some day and try to find any fossils.

questions.text: What is the sign of the goat?
Which Greek letter symbolizes the ratio of circumference to the diameter?

questions.explanation:
3.14

	3.14 is the figure corrected to two decimal places. It is, in fact, an infinite number.
